com.esri.mo2.client.io
Class BaseEsrimap

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.esri.mo2.client.io.BaseEsrimap
All Implemented Interfaces:
Esrimap
public class BaseEsrimap
extends Object
implements Esrimap

Constructs a proxy object that references a remote ESRIMAP instance.

You can provide either a "complete" or "partial" URL reference to an ESRIMAP. A complete reference directly identifies the ESRIMAP object, for example, http://yourserver/servlet/com.esri.esrimap.Esrimap. A partial reference only identifies the web server where the ESRIMAP object is supposed to exist, for example, http://yourserver/.

If you choose to specify a partial reference, then the code will attempt to "ping" the ESRIMAP to determine if it exists, and which type of ESRIMAP it might be. The three ESRIMAP types supported (in the order tested) are,

  • ArcIMS version 3.x servlet ESRIMAP
  • IMS version 2.0/1.0 ISAPI (MS Web server) ESRIMAP
  • IMS version 2.0/1.0 NSAPI (Netscape Web server) ESRIMAP
    Ping attempts are performed for each ESRIMAP type, in the above order, until a successful ping occurs.

    If you specify a complete reference, the code will first attempt to ping the URL. If unsuccessful, the code will assume you provided a partial reference, and will follow the partial reference strategy to obtain a successful ping.

    An exception is thrown, if a successful ping fails to occur.

    See Also:
    Esrimap, UnableToPingEsrimapException
